member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.RollingFlatFileSink
member.summary: A sink that writes to a flat file with a rolling overwrite behavior.
Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified values.
member.param: The filename where the entries will be logged.
The maximum file size (KB) before rolling.
The date format that will be appended to the new roll file.
Expected behavior that will be used when the roll file has to be created.
The time interval that makes the file to be rolled.
The maximum number of archived files to keep.
Specifies if the writing should be done asynchronously, or synchronously with a blocking call.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer
member.summary: Helper class to validate the correctness of instances. Useful in unit tests.

example.remarks: Where 'Instance' property returns a singleton instance of 'MyEventSource' class like: public static MyEventSource Instance = new MyEventSource();

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.InspectAll(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)
member.summary: Inspects the specified for potential runtime errors.
member.param: The event source instance to inspect.

example.remarks: Where 'Instance' property returns a singleton instance of 'MyEventSource' class like: public static MyEventSource Instance = new MyEventSource();

member.exception: Exception thrown if a failure was found in the specified .
Exception thrown if a failure was found in the specified .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.Inspect(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)
member.summary: Inspects the specified for potential runtime errors filtering out validations according to the specified instance properties.
member.param: The event source instance to inspect.

example.remarks: Where 'Instance' property returns a singleton instance of 'MyEventSource' class like: public static MyEventSource Instance = new MyEventSource();

member.exception: Exception thrown if a failure was found in the specified .
Exception thrown if a failure was found in the specified .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.ExcludeEventListenerEmulation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude the internal instance to emulate sending events.
member.remarks: The analyzer performs a 'probing' execution using an internal instance to emulate logging using the inspected instance. By excluding this analysis, no ETW events will be sent in case of executing the analysis from a running application where ETW events may be monitored.
member.value: true for excluding this analysis, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.ExcludeWriteEventTypeMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude an exact type mapping between the event arguments and 'EventSource.WriteEvent' argument.
member.value: true for excluding this analysis, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.ExcludeWriteEventTypeOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude the type order analysis between the event arguments and the 'EventSource.WriteEvent' arguments order. This process is costly and may be excluded for large event sources with events with many arguments. However it is recommended to leave this option off (default) to ensure that all 'EventSource.WriteEvent' arguments are correctly mapped to the event parameters.
member.value: true for excluding this analysis, false otherwise.

member.summary: Gets the event task.

member.summary: Gets the operation code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Properties.Resources.EventSourceAnalyzerBadFormedManifestError
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Am event type argument could not be properly serializaed into an event source manifest. Verify any Enum type other than Int32 or Int64 and replace it with any of these allowed types. For further infromation about the Enum issue read: http://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/785409/eventsource-manifest-generation-creates-wrong-map-values-for-enum-types-other-than-int32-or-int64.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of WriteEvent arguments and event parameters are different in event name '{0}'..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to EventSource manifest generation failure. {0} Manifest: {1}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Properties.Resources.EventSourceAnalyzerMismatchParametersOrder
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The parameter name '{0}' defined in the event '{1}' does not match the order in WriteEvent function..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Properties.Resources.EventSourceAnalyzerMismatchParametersType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The parameter name '{0}' with type '{1}' does not match the payload type '{2}' in method '{3}'. Check the parameter type in WriteEvent and assign a type that matches the same event arguement type . .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Properties.Resources.EventSourceAnalyzerMissingWriteEventCallError

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Properties.Resources.EventSourceAnalyzerNullPayloadValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The payload argument in position '{0}' is sending a null value which may not map to the parameter '{1}' in event '{2}'..
